p: With respect to the single cell electrophoresis, there are currently only three studies. In one of them, this assay was only used as an evaluation test, while in the others, the genoprotective capacity of these algae was evaluated by means of the comet and micronucleus tests. In the first, the beneficial effect of S. platensis on tissue lipid peroxidation and oxidative DNA damage were analyzed with the hypercholesterolemic New Zealand white rabbit model. After adding two concentrations of alga (1% and 5%) to the diet for eight weeks, the supplement showed a significant reduction on the level of lipid peroxidation and DNA damage of lymphocytes in rabbits fed with a cholesterol-enriched diet [ 26].
